result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Wiktorek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED. ($823.94) Balance of $69.06 to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
BAIL APPLIED. Restitution paid in full. To be forwarded to Roundy's.
BAIL APPLIED. DNA paid in full.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Pick N Save.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED; to be used at Agent's discretion to determine huber or straight time.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher J Wiktorek in court with attorney Meg Colleen O'Marro.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment so she can work out the restitution solution. State has no objections. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Christopher J Wiktorek in court with attorney Meg Colleen O'Marro.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as she needs more time to speak with the attorney handling this case. State has no objections. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher J Wiktorek in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has been working on resolving this matter and is requesting a new date. Court sets for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with any Pick n Save stores.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Christopher J Wiktorek in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
